title: how long is the agreement between author and publisher valid for? - Quora

response.answer_text: The duration of the agreement with your publisher is mentioned in the publisher’s contract itself. It varies depending on the terms you have agreed upon. Yes, you can change your publisher in most cases. Look for an exit clause in the contract. It will state what you have to do. I was unhappy with one of my publishers because they were horrible at distributing my book. Fortunately, there was an exit clause which said I’d have to buy back the copies of my book they had in stock. I could easily do that (the publisher hadn’t even printed many copies) and get out of the contract.

Hi! The term of agreement varies from publisher to publisher. At Woven Words Publishers, we sign the agreement for lifetime, but we allow the authors to retain the copyright. Therefore, the authors enjoys royalties throughout his life. Regards, Mosiur Rehman, Publisher, Woven Words Publishers
